div.p: Dear gracious lord, following my previous letter, another letter also comes to me from Italy, in which there is a secret outcry that the Guise and Spanish Cardinal of Lorraine have an agreement; their military forces are gathering in Flanders and then moving further. It is worth noting where to. Also, a guardsman from Glarus, who serves in France, writes that there is great unrest among them, that no one is safe regarding their faith, and many are concerned about misfortune.

Therefore, it is necessary to be vigilant; in my opinion, there might be a plan as before, when the Guise committed the massacre at Wassy and captured the king and queen. They had also previously sent the Swiss Confederates to France. I did not want to withhold this from you; for I would gladly prevent harm in this world.
On the 7th of January, in the year 1567. Your willing Joachim BÃ¤ldi.
